admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Southern Provinces
            Electrification Project in Laos are as follows: overall
            outcome of the project was rated highly satisfactory, and
            the performance of the Bank and the Borrower were also rated
            as satisfactory. Some of the lessons learned from the
            project are: 1) while Electricite du Laos (EdL) is effective
            at implementing International Development Association
            (IDA)-financed projects, its relatively inexperienced staff
            needs to be supplemented with technical assistance and
            continuous training; 2) EdL, as the repository of the power
            sector's technical expertise, needs control over the
            development, implementation, and operation of the systems
            being developed under internationally-financed projects; 3)
            to enable EdL to cope with the growing complexity, its
            increasing role as regulator and supervisor, partner in
            large-scale joint venture projects, and the geographical
            dispersion of its business, past informal practices for
            managing operations and implementing projects need to be
            supplemented with more formal systems and procedures, modern
            technology, and communications facilities.
